name: Maria Therese ASSA'AD-FALTAS, petitioner, v. RICHLAND COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT, et al.
name_abbreviation: Assa'ad-Faltas v. Richland Cnty. Sheriff's Dep't

court.name: Supreme Court of the United States

parties:
Maria Therese ASSA'AD-FALTAS, petitioner,
v.
RICHLAND COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT, et al.

opinions.text: Motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pauperisdenied, and petition for writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit dismissed. See Rule 39.8. As petitioner has repeatedly abused this Court's process, the Clerk is directed not to accept any further petitions in noncriminal matters from petitioner unless the docketing fee required by Rule 38(a) is paid and petition submitted in compliance with Rule 33.1. See Martin v. District of Columbia Court of Appeals,506 U.S. 1, 113 S.Ct. 397, 121 L.Ed.2d 305 (1992)(per curiam).

casebody.head_matter:
Maria Therese ASSA'AD-FALTAS, petitioner,
v.
RICHLAND COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT, et al.
No. 14-7472.
Supreme Court of the United States
Feb. 23, 2015.
Opinion
